intro: Hieracium wiesbaurianum subsp. epirense, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
